title: John Stanley: Giving Life To Little Lulu
description: This is a biography of one of the most influential “girl power” comic book writer/artists ( Little Lulu , Nancy ) of the mid-20th century. This is a deluxe, full-color, coffee table book biography; the first of one of America’s greatest storytellers. It's filled with beautifully reproduced artwork from the comic books Little Lulu , and his creations Melvin Monster and Thirteen (Going on Eighteen) ; rare drawings and cartoons; and never-before-seen photographs. Bill Schelly tells Stanley’s life story through interviews with his family, friends, and his childhood in Harlem and the Bronx, life with his strict Irish Catholic mother, his education at Parsons, his first job as an animator at Max Fleischer Studios, and his years working as a commercial artist, before finding his true métier in comic books during World War II (while battling clinical depression and alcoholism). Prose with illustrations.
author: Bill Schelly
